poem:
Title: "Verity in Velvet Shadows"

In these vast Arctic extents of power,
Lies a choice not missed but stolen,
Iron fists clad in velvet.
The West wails, but the East is silent,
Smothered beneath repression's blanket.
A despot crowned, in guise of election,
Beneath his glacial gaze, dissent frozen.
Alas, a tarnished triumph,
A victory wasted on winter's breath.
An enduring reign not of reverence, but of ashes.
